title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 181.10 - Facility responsibilities for the return of awol youth
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 181.10 - Facility responsibilities for the return of awol youth

State Regulations
(a) All facilities from which a youth has
absconded must accept the youth back. (b) If the facility feels it can no longer
handle the youth, the appropriate youth service team should be informed
immediately. In cases of emergency, the district supervisor, the regional
director, or an appropriate person at the Albany central office should be
contacted immediately. Under no circumstances should a returning AWOL youth be
released to the community or to the street. (c) The youth service team must work out a
new placement for those youth deemed inappropriate for the facility in which
they currently are residing. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 9

181.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
